alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Fall River; Hermosa Foot Hills; Oglala Lakota; Southern Foot Hills; Todd (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued March 28 at 3:35AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...VERY HIGH TO EXTREME GRASSLAND FIRE DANGER ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA TODAY... .DISCUSSION...Skies will be mostly sunny today with high temperatures ranging from the 60s over northwest South Dakota to the lower 80s over far southwest South Dakota. Winds will be south to southeast at 10 to 25 mph across most of the area, with gusts to 40 mph across south central South Dakota. Southwesterly winds at 10 to 20 mph with higher gusts will develop across far southwest South Dakota this afternoon. Minimum relative humidities will range from 10 to 15 percent across far southwest South Dakota to around 25 percent across northwest South Dakota. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Tuesday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the high category to very high category.
